titleStmt.title: Here begynneth a shorte and abreue table on the Cronycles ...
Saint Albans chronicle.
titleStmt.author: Higden, Ranulf, d. 1364. Polycronicon. English. Selections.
Trevisa, John, d. 1402.

publicationStmt.publisher: In powlys chyrche yarde at the west dore of powlys besyde my lorde of londons palays by me Iulyan Notary,
publicationStmt.date: In the yere of our lorde god. M.CCCCC.xv. [1515]]

notesStmt.note: Known as "The Saint Albans chronicle"; not the same compilation as the "Chronicles of England" first printed by Caxton (STC 9991-4).
Title from opening words of text, pi1v.
Text commences on leaf i: In soo moche that it is necessary to all creatures of crysten relygyon, or of false relygyon ..
Includes "The dyscrypcyon of Englonde", an excerpt from: Higden, Ranulf. Polycronicon.
The first page contains woodcuts with ornamenal border. The bottom border contains Maltese crosses, thus the first quire is sometimes said to be signed with a cross.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
